I mainly use Brave browser with no additional extensions except ipfs-companion. With ipfs-desktop. Debian.

Firefox for some applications with ::
- Ublock 
- Decentraleyes 
- Dat P2P Protocol 
- NoScript Security Suite 

Honestly, I read contradictory post about extension usage.
Extensions also leave traces. The less the better is also claimed.

Beaker browser. 
Surf and Share :dat//urls. Host in a view steps a local website or share files. Not anonymous.
With some tricks the dat//url can be translated to https. Interesting browser.

With Dat-fox extension for FF you don't need beaker-browser to visit dat//sites.

Qutebrowser using under a shortcut for Deepl translations. (secure translation )
Qutebrowser is keyboard oriented. GG services are banned since 2019.
